ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 60
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Once again, your real life experiences have no bearing on EQ, a fantasy role-playing game. Maybe you need a rest every 3-5 minutes because your stamina is
ygData.messageBody:
> Date: Fri, 11 Jun 1999 09:32:11 -0700
> From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
>Subject: Re: Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
>
>But the Warrior does have a limiting factor: Stamina. Once again, I will
>draw from my experience in wielding broad swords in real life. After about
>3 to 5 minutes of constant fighting, in 100 lbs. of armor guess what, you
>are wiped out and need to rest a bit. Just like the mage has to rest while
>dealing out those spells, we warriors should need to rest after fighting in
>all that armor and swinging that 3 to 5 lbs. sword around, 9 lbs. in the
>case of great swords.


Once again, your real life experiences have no bearing on EQ, a fantasy
role-playing game.

Maybe you need a rest every 3-5 minutes because your stamina is much lower
than that of a troll or barbarian. Maybe if you spent your whole life
training to be a warrior, you would have greater stamina. EQ Warriors can
fight longer than your 3-5 minutes because they exercise instead of playing
video games.


Wayne
